result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark C Peters II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber, release for standard conditions if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Violent contact with the victim. Continue with current mental health treatment and follow through including any medications that may be prescribed. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED for completion of the Community Service. Non-working hours if imposed.

Defendant to perform 80 hours of Community Service in lieu of serving Condition time. To be completed within 6 months. Failure to complete the 80 hours, the court will lift the stay on the condition time.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Steven Hughes has been appointed to represent the defendant.

Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

02:29 PM Defendant Mark C Peters in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern Patrick Sicula.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
